title: Understanding Deleting vs. Clearing
text: When you delete cells, you remove them entirely from the worksheet, which can affect the layout of your data. On the other hand, clearing cells only removes the content within them, leaving the cells themselves intact.

title: Effects on Data Layout
text: Deleting cells can cause other cells to shift, potentially altering the structure of your worksheet. Clearing cells does not cause any shifts, as it only removes the data within the cells.

hintAnswer: deleting removes the cells from the worksheet while clearing only erases their values
title: Choose the Correct Statement
text: Which of the following statements is true?
choices: deleting removes the cells from the worksheet while clearing only erases their values
clearing removes the cells from the worksheet while deleting only erases their values
